title: Hive failures due to `baseFee` versus `baseFeePerGas`
body:
Besu currently fails all london-tests, https://hivetests.ethdevops.io/?page=v-pills-results-tab&suite=1623797831-73d7cf70ef6bffbad42d56b3643e68f9.json . 
Example: 
```
Name
add_d4g0v0_London

Description
Test source: https://github.com/ethereum/tests/blob/develop/BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/VMTests/vmArithmeticTest/add.json

Details

Executing test
%!(EXTRA string=name, string=add_d4g0v0_London, string=root, string=besu/cae1aba61260c23203c8b8655de749d98537def0, string=genesis, string=besu/cae1aba61260c23203c8b8655de749d98537def0/genesis.json)genesis mismatch:
  want 0xafa8fc2deb658d8120f4011e459159a6472b88e2dfed6518640be01dbbfd20a9
   got 0xa29ba2a76546b56f331f02e70b24c4a1452b1b392e1d2fe51828ff57f551d62e
```
Geth also failed that earlier, because we tried to parse `baseFee` in the genesis config, however, we had to [change](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/23039) it due to changes in ethereum/tests. 

After we changed it, tests started passing. The `baseFeePerGas` is the correct (according to EIP) term, and should be what the config/genesis parser uses. 

Which is funny, because IIUC you changed it the other way around not long ago: https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/commit/2cc6778417fc632186189fa3424c5464f5392954
